eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyInfo: Within the illusion, Pepe experiences everything Zubayr went through. She makes the same choice he did, passes the test, and is released by Mio. Inside the museum, Narantuya decides to prevent the city from sinking into the sands.

attributes.content: Now where did I end up this time?!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: A waterfall?!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe sees the same boy by the waterfall with his head down, washing something.
She quickens her steps in a bid to get the boy to notice her, and realizes he has grown taller and more mature since she last saw him.
The boy has become a young man.
Okay, enough! I don't care who you are, just let me leave... you...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You're hurt? Your face...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Don't worry, sister. Most of the blood is the enemy's.
attributes.name: Injured Youth

attributes.content: The battlefield was more complicated than I expected, but they were no match for me. I won.
attributes.name: Injured Youth

attributes.content: Zubayr, I went to a temple in the Arsalan rainforest and got a blessed amulet for you.
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: I pray it can protect you from harm.
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: I'm not afraid of wounds, sister. These scars prove I have grown.
attributes.name: Injured Youth

attributes.content: Pepe looks down and spots a longsword lying horizontally by the half-kneeling youth.
Several streams of fresh blood flow from the sword down into the nearby pool, dyeing the water pink.
Pepe turns her head and sees the girl behind her with a gentle smile on her face, but also concern in her eyes.
She turns back only to find the scenery around her has changed once again.
Within the rainforest, the youth holds up a dagger, turning it over as he inspects it.
Congratulations. You'll be leading Father's garrison from tomorrow.
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: This was the job you dreamed of, so why do you seem so unhappy?
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: I don't know either. This commander's dagger is too light compared to the work and suffering I went through for it.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: What about you, sister? Are you not glad for me?
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: No, Zubayr. I'll only be glad when you are too.
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: The books you spent countless days and nights on. Did you find anything?
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Zubayr, Sargon's history extends past what we can imagine, and we lack a complete record in our manuscripts.
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: I plan to compile a volume that records past events that have been missed or omitted. Hopefully...
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: Hopefully...?
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Hopefully, it will complete the account of Sargon's history.
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: That will be a thick book... there are so many people you'd need to include.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Father has agreed to my idea, and has promised to help me.
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: Very Nice. I see we've both achieved what we wanted.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Pepe watches the boy sheathe his dagger as he smiles at his sister.
Where am I this time?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: When does this one take place...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Zubayr... why do you seem upset?
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: That Kuranta from the east has changed Father into a much different man.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: All these years, Father had remained stoic, even in the face of uprisings and challenges from various tribes. Time and again, he would reorganize his troops and fly his banners.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: When Father sliced his enemies apart with his sword, even the warm blood that spurted from their necks could not melt the cold gaze behind his mask.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: But that Nightzmora... when Father fought him, I could almost see sparks—not just from their clashing weapons, but also in his eyes.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: I had never seen him look at anyone with such fervor.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Zubayr, I can sense it... our father's passion for our country has long since faded.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: I heard some worrying news. Father plans to invite Kharanduu Khagan down south to wage war against those invisible foes.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: You're going with them, are you not?
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Those strange enemies have already been encroaching on our land, bit by bit.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: The Shah... you're both children of the Shah...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: As she follows the youth's gaze toward the far horizon, the distant land suddenly gets pulled right before her.
Pepe sees a barren desert devoid of green as her eyelids are buffeted by sand.
...The Foehn hotlands...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: How are you feeling, Zubayr?
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: I'm fine, sister.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: I'll need to remove your bandages to reapply the medicine. Bear with me, I'll be quick.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: It's alright, I feel no pain.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: How can that be... When they carried you back here, your entire body was charred.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: What should I do, Zubayr...? Father is missing and you're the only kin I have left.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Brother has taken the throne, but we do not share the same mother. Your military achievements have already made him wary.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: That historian... is he treating you well?
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Yes... With his help, the volume is already half-done. Perhaps I could manage to see it complete within my lifetime.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Careful not to overwork yourself.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: It is my promise to Father... Even if I fail to complete it, the child within me will continue my work. One day, it will recount everything that has happened here to future generations.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: It will be a bridge across the vastness of time, connecting the readers with those recorded over the great river of time.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: I hear they plan to build a cenotaph for Father.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Before he left, Father confided in me about a trove filled with the land's treasures. He instructed me to reveal its location only to the descendants of the Nightzmora.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Brother will not be happy when he learns of this.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Sister, you chose to record Father's every word and action to memorialize his departure, while I chose to protect everything he left behind.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Father has only just left, and already war rages among the western tribes... I must go and quell the unrest.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: But how... how will you go in your current condition?
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: A gemstone artisan from Arsalan told me he could preserve my consciousness into gemstones inscribed with special circuits.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: The craftsmen who created the Zhayedan are also willing to build me a new body.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Did you already decide on this before telling me about it, Zubayr?
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Sister, I do not wish to be bed-bound forever...
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: Zubayr, I only wish for you to be happy, and nothing more.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Promise me you'll never forget this.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: I promise.
attributes.name: Quiet Youth

attributes.content: (Where... am I?)
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: (So dark... is anyone here?)
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: (Wh-Why can't I talk?)
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: (Drat, I can't move at all. My limbs are all bound so tightly.)
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Are you ready? I'm about to remove the brain.
(Brain?)
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Administer more sedative, his pulse is still beating rather rapidly and I need him to be calm.
(Are you talking about my brain?!)
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: A cover is lifted and light pours in. Pepe finds herself lying on the center of a stone platform.
People around her come and go as they apply sticky, pungent medicine, tightly wrapping her body with linen, constricting her attempts at movement.
Her observations are cut short when an old man walks towards her with a small knife in hand. Pepe would have panicked, but the sedative starts to take effect.
She feels someone holding her head down, and the tiny blade inches towards her forehead...
(Is this what Zubayr went through?)
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: (When they transferred his consciousness... he was still alive.)
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Is it over? Is this what you wanted to show me, Zubayr?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Tell me, what else did you go through?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.text: After quelling the rebellions for my brother, I bade farewell to my sister and ventured alone into this desert. Here, I stood guardian over the treasure Father entrusted to me, awaiting the arrival of a Nightzmora descendant.
Yet, through the long centuries of change, the Nightzmoran have forgotten Father's promise to Kharanduu Khagan. They never came—even when I was vanquished and sealed beneath the sands.

attributes.content: And you spent nearly a thousand years just waiting here?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.text: I have witnessed lives come into being and pass away, cities rise and fall. With prosperity comes decline, and with life comes death—an inevitability for all.
And with each end comes a new beginning, the cycle repeating endlessly.
Father was right; everything that transpires is but a continual 'time loop,' and the future is naught but a repetition of the past.
I began to hate myself for choosing to become eternal.
I wished to forget, but my sophisticated memory system prevented me from doing so. It kept my experiences fresh and vivid in my mind, every detail distinctly clear.
Pepe, you once told me you wished to become one who remembers history, both written and unrecorded. You wish to witness the truth behind the history with your own eyes.
But that comes with a price, Pepe.

attributes.content: Tell me, Zubayr. In your long life, even with the unbearable suffering you've been through, did you ever consider forgetting your father or sister?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: That's my answer too.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: We should remember the things that shouldn't be forgotten, even if they bring us pain.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'm... back.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: There is no gigantic, ferocious beast, moist rainforest, or scorching sandstorm.
In the middle of the street sits only a small animal, casually licking its fur.
Why did you bring me inside Zubayr's memories?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: It was a test he set for you. You could only see him if you passed it.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Was he the one talking to me inside the illusion?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: No, that was actually me. Though the question was indeed his.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Did I pass?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You failed, so just run off back to wherever you came from, little girl.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: He seemed pretty satisfied with my answer though?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: No, you just imagined it!
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: I have to see him. He's the one who started the unrest in the city, so only he can stop it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Besides... he's the only one who can help me reach the City of Gold, so I can't miss this last chance.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Silly girl. Do you think being the Historian of Shar-Agade is a good thing?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: You serve at the hand of the Shahanshah, and so your tongue is cut out to ensure you can never speak his secrets.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: You write only what the Shahanshah wants written. You are no longer yourself, only a gilded mouthpiece.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Is this what you want, foolish girl?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Where did you learn all that? The City of Gold isn't a place some random animal can wander into.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Foolish girl, my first human pet was Lugalszargus's own daughter!
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: I saw with my own eyes when the poor girl had her tongue cut out by her very brother!
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Enough, Mio.
She has passed Zubayr's test. Speak no more and let her pass.
He awaits you at the second-last house in the third alley from here. Remember this, once you enter, knock thrice on the left door, then push the right door open.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: You will see him there.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Insolent cur, she didn't pass the test! Why did you tell her!
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: She passed the test, Mio. Enough of this.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: She did not if I say so! She failed!
attributes.name: Mio
Mio
attributes.content: You fool, do you want this girl to...?

attributes.name: Mio
attributes.content: Release me!
attributes.joined: You fool, do you want this girl to...?Release me!

attributes.content: Our mission is complete! Let's go!
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Mroaw—!
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Woof grabs Mio by the scruff and disappears down the alley, leaving behind only drag marks.
Phew... Third alley, second-last house...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Knock thrice on the left door...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: And then open the right...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: We meet again, Pepe.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Question. Would I have found you if I didn't follow the instructions exactly?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Actually, you would have found me no matter which door you opened. The key is whether you truly wish to meet me.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Zubayr, I've come here with a hammer.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Do you intend to intimidate me with force?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I can't promise I won't use it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: We don't have much time left, so just answer my questions. Truthfully.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Ask your questions, Pepe. I will answer them faithfully—not out of fear, but because it is my choice.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Have you found the fourth gemstone?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Yes. Someone was keeping it safe for me. Their family passed it down through the generations, waiting for the day I would awaken and return.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Did you decide to destroy the entire city the moment you got it? The whole place is in chaos because of the jewel constructs.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe, I apologize for what is happening to the city, but I have to do it. My duty compels me.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: 'Fourth, the liver. We go into the night, awake and alert, for duty and obligation.' Are your memories related to your duties complete?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: So where's the Shah's treasure trove?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Right below our feet, underneath the city of Menat-Ha'mait.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: You could say this city was founded by, and is prosperous because of the infinite treasures left behind by Father.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: When he left us, I had his cenotaph built in the deepest reach of his trove, so that it may also serve as his tomb.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: For centuries they kept digging underground, and every artifact or treasure they found in the mausoleum became fuel for the city.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: This is my fault, but it is not too late. There is still a chance to stop it, as they have yet to dig into its depths... for the treasure that mustn't be touched by the wrong hands.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: What is that exactly?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Patience, Pepe. I was just about to show it to you.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: A beam of sunlight pierces through the window, illuminating the floor beside Zubayr's feet.
He raises his staff high, and suddenly a strong wind stirs from nowhere. The sistrum chimes as it jingles.
Pepe hears Zubayr hum a tune that feels familiar, though its cryptic lyrics elude her understanding.
She then feels the ground beneath her feet soften, her ankles sinking into a flowing sea of sand.
As Zubayr finishes his tune, he plunges the staff into the ground.
In an instant, sand and dust swirl wildly, enveloping them both until they vanish.
Water! Bring some water!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Hurry! Your curator spoke too much and is having a heatstroke!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Bad news, Medjehtiqedti Hanim—I'm afraid the museum hasn't had running water for a while now.
Or to be more precise, sand is pouring out of the taps. Can't even stop it.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Do you work here? I don't recognize you...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: No, wait, sand... pouring from the taps?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Yep. By the way, we met your staff at the entrance and he asked me to pass on this leave request and a bunch of books.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: It was unclear where he was headed.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: The river water is too muddy to be used, and all the nearby water channels are full of nothing but sand.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: And all of these happened while we made our way here. As quickly as a rising tide...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Talk about a Flood Festival, only it's sand.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Hey, Hanim? Why'd you turn so quiet? Bad time to make witty comments I see.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Anat! Anat! Wake up, hurry!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: W-We're... WE'RE GOING TO DIE!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: You've only just realized that? After everything that's happened today?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Medjehtiqedti Hanim, could you explain what's going on?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: To put it simply, if every gem in the city can be removed from its place, then the ones used for water purification are no exception.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: If too many of them are removed, the water purification system will stop working, changing the internal pressure and causing sand to intrude.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: ...If this happens, the constructs will have an endless supply of sand to build their pillars and walls, ruining the city.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Also, Titi... I'm worried about something worse...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Such a sudden pressure change will almost certainly damage the city's ancient underground river canal system.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I didn't want to mention it, for fear of it coming true! Now I'm really scared of this city!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Go on, what happens when the underground canals are damaged?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: A large volume of water will seep out and loosen the sand, forming quicksand.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: The whole city will sink underground, and the modern materials the constructs can't use will be buried deep down in the earth.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: And this is just speculation... but the constructs have been building their pillars and walls for a specific reason.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: They're trying to recreate the way the place looked in their memories.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: We, along with centuries of urban landscape, will be buried beneath the sands.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Do you need me to elaborate further?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Nah, I got you.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: If this city sinks under the sand, everyone dies, including my crew. We're royally screwed.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: So, there's only one path I can take to keep them safe, yes?
attributes.name: Narantuya
